text: are you able to share your listing / post page with me?

Maybe I’m not understanding your issue, so let me tell you what I think you are having an issue with.

You have this pagination under your blog posts. This allows a user to go to the previous blog and the next blog.

On a very specific page, you believe that the next blog link should work and take you to a specific blog post, however it is not working. I believe that you are saying that the button doesn’t work.

Is that the issue you are having?

If that is the issue you are having, then here are some questions.

What page is this happening on? Are you able to share the URL.

Why do you believe that the next link should work and send you to another blog? What data is telling you that there is another blog?
Is there any way to tell HubSpot to minify internal CSS?
As in, inline CSS? If so — I don’t believe that there is.

Ah, yeah — I don’t believe there’s any way to minify inline styles within HubSpot.

HubSpot doesn’t seem to do any optimization of markup files, and seems to just count on Gzip or Brotli to be effective enough on their own. _(which they generally are)_ Even excess whitespace in markup doesn’t get trimmed.
thanks for sharing your solution <@U067MMA95PX>! bookmarking
